intro: Melanthesa racemosa, commonly known as the clustered melilot, is a flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Its compound leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Melanthesa racemosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
